channel.title: If you made a successful server or even a server plz help!
channel.description:
Hey i know im asking for alot but can someone help me make my server? I will give you co-owner or owner because i am a noob and i really would like to make a server. My base is Broken-X 508. Please someone help. :)
I also have hotmail and Teamviewer. My hotmail acc is brandontobiaftw@hotmail.com
EDIT: Read my last comment!!!!

item.title: If you made a successful server or even a server plz help!
item.dc:creator: @ownerofextremepvp ownerofextremepvp
item.description:
@ownerofextremepvp wrote:

im done all i need is to get hamachi running and i might close this post down to put up a new post about how to startup hamachi but TY all for your help!!!

Read full topic

watch tuts or ask some ppl some server helpers can add u on msn.

item.source: If you made a successful server or even a server plz help!

item.title: If you made a successful server or even a server plz help!
item.dc:creator: @patargangstar patargangstar
item.description:
@patargangstar wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

In all honesty, just start learning basic Java before you start coding servers so you can know what your actually changing instead of relying on tuts.

^

OFT: Why are you using hamachi? thats problem #1 hamachi is ghetto rsps no one uses it anymore its just a pain in the ass for something thats so simple to do.

OT: start with a 317, as you get into higher revisions the coding gets more and more complex (for obvious reasons) a 317 is a good base to start off of, pi has good orginisation usually, easy to start with just not too stable or reliable in the long run.

http://download.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/index.html
trust me, read it, understand it, use it. no one likes a leech

Read full topic

item.title: If you made a successful server or even a server plz help!
item.dc:creator: @Marine5288 Marine5288
item.description:
@Marine5288 wrote:

If you’re going to make a server for this first time, start off easy and use a Project Insanity source(317). I would recommend

using these simple tutorials, they will help a lot

in the future. As many users said, use the search bar, that’s how most people learn. Good luck!

Read full topic
item.source: If you made a successful server or even a server plz help!

its acually not that simple. for some reason i tryed that and my hamichi stoped working and my client doesnt work online. i finally fixed it now i just need to change the login page, which im clueless about, and help with hamichi to see what im doing wrong. I finally fixed it up but those are the 2 only things that i need to fix.

item.title: If you made a successful server or even a server plz help!
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

I’ve been coding for years. At first i couldn’t even figure out how to pickup items, But after years of following guides, Looking at tutorials i’m not even going to use, i’ve learned so much that ive opened so many servers. So just keep practicing and you will get better at it.

Read full topic
